results.title: Gypsy
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Philip Anderson, Mervyn LeRoy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque Queen of renown, was driven to stardom much less by her own ambition, than by the ruthless determination of her mother. As the stereotypical domineering “stage mother”, Rosalind Russell’s performance is superb, while Karl Malden as her long-suffering but loyal lover also gives a fine performance. While the references to striptease are undeniably fleeting, Natalie Wood as Gypsy Rose Lee is creditable, but it is her vulnerability rather than her sex appeal which comes to the fore. Stephen Sondheim’s lyrics and Julie Styne’s score makes this a musical delight.

results.title: The Party
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Blake Edwards and Peter Sellers combine in another comic masterpiece. This time Sellers is not the bumbling Closeau, but the much maligned and accident-prone Indian actor Hrundi V. Bakshi. Hollywood mogul, Fred Clutterbuck is giving the Hollywood party of the century, complete with beautiful women, powerful men and “wanna-be stars.” Blackballed by his producer for wrecking a day’s shooting, Bakshi finds himself unexpectedly invited to the party. Once this walking disaster area enters the festivities, destruction and mayhem follows. A satire on the artifice and snobbery of Tinseltown and a must for lovers of Sellers’ unique comic style. Co-starring Claudine Longet, Marge Champion and Steve Franken with a musical score by Henry Mancini.

results.title: Germinal
results.brief_description: Emile Zola based “Germinal” on a trip made in 1884 through rural France, observing the conditions of coal miners. This pivotal novel raised awareness of the miners’ plight as they struggled to survive inhumane and dangerous conditions for the profit of the mine owners. Maheu, (Gerard Depardieu) is a miner. He and his wife (Miou Miou) and family eke out a miserable existence in the mines. Their lives are changed when Etienne Lantier (Renaud) enters the district and orginises a miner’s union. Nevertheless, the quest for profit at all costs causes a further disintegration of conditions and results in a terrible mining accident. Despite the almost unrelieved harshness and pessimism of the subject matter, the film is an excellent historical document of an era; vividly contrasting the squalidness of the miners’ lives to the opulent lifestyle enjoyed by the mine owners. French dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Logan's run
results.creator_credit: Michael Anderson, Saul David and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Welcome to the 23rd Century, a perfect world of total pleasure. The only thing you can’t have is your 30th birthday. On Lastday, senior citizens must go through the ritual of “renewal” where a fiery carousel spins them into oblivion. Michael York is Logan, a loyal citizen whose job is to seek and destroy “runners”, sceptics who seek to escape the ceremonial execution. Fast approaching his own time of renewal, he becomes a runner in order to seek refuge from his hedonistic, automated world. Based on the novel “Logans run” by William F. Nolan, this classic science fiction film, distinguished by awesome spectacle, won an Academy Award for Best Special Effects and was the first film to use laser beam holography.

results.title: The Secret life of Walter Mitty
results.brief_description: Walter Mitty is a dreamer. To escape the humdrum of his life and his shrewish mother, Walter’s secret life is rich and exciting by comparison. Walter’s daydream personnas include a western gunslinger, a world-famous surgeon, a RAF pilot and a Mississippi river boat gambler. A mysterious and beautiful blonde is always by his side. Suddenly Walter is thrust into a real-life adventure when he comes to the rescue of a ravishing blonde trying to escape a gang of jewel thieves. Danny Kaye brings all his comic genius into the role of Walter Mitty and is supported by Boris Karloff and Virginia Mayo. Based on the renown short story by James Thurber, this is a comic fantasy which can be enjoyed by all.

results.title: Mame
results.creator_credit: Gene Saks, James Cresson, Robert Fryer, ABC-TV (Australia) and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Lucille Ball’s last film, “Mame” is a fantasy romp through the twenties: a time of Prohibition, the Depression and Grand Tours of the world on luxury liners. “Mame” is a musical feast featuring such songs as “My Best Girl” and “We Need a Little Christmas.” Auntie Mame is a larger than life character who parties her way through life in the charge of her orphaned nephew. Based on the award winning Broadway musical.

results.title: Hearts of darkness: a filmmaker's apocalypse
results.creator_credit: Eleanor Coppola, George Hickenlooper, Fax Bahr, Les Mayfield, George Zaloom and ZM Productions
results.brief_description: The making of “Apocalypse now” was almost the breaking of famed director Francis Ford Coppola. For three years Coppola drove and dragged his actors, including Robert Duvall, Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando, and his crew through torturous conditions to complete his epic portrayal of the Vietnam War. Recreating the savagery of war left its mark - Sheen overcame a heart attack to finish the film and Coppola privately questioned his sanity. This riveting, funny and at times shocking film charts the progress of Coppola’s dream, which he personally funded to completion. It is brutally honest and includes improvisation, often drug-induced, which made it to the big screen as “brilliant performances”. Features exclusively restored footage previously deleted from “Apocalypse now”, “Hearts of darkness” is a tragedy, comedy and disaster rolled into one.

results.title: Little women (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Louisa May Alcott’s popular novel is brought vividly to life in this second screen adaption of “Little Women.” The March sisters are Jo (June Allyson), Beth (Janet Leigh), Amy (a blonde Elizabeth Taylor) and Meg (child-star Margaret O’Brien). Their father has left for the Civil War, leaving the girls under the watchful eye of their mother (Mary Astor). Far removed from war and safe within their New England home, the “little women” are a closely-knit family and a picture of happiness. When Laurie (Peter Lawford), the grandson of a rich neighbor arrives, the orderly world of the March family is disrupted. The sisters are smitten by this handsome stranger and a story of romance, rivalry, love and loss follows. As the high spirited and determined Jo, June Allyson gives one of the finest performances of her career, ably supported by the superb ensemble cast. The film is beautifully crafted and deservedly received an Academy Award nomination for its exceptional cinematography. Co-starring Rossano Brazzi as Professor Bhaer.

results.title: Hammers over the anvil
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Ben Gannon, South Australian Film Corporation and Harvest Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the stories of the same title by Alan Marshall, this is the story of a young boy who suffered many hardships in life, but none so savage as contracting polio and being unable to walk without crutches. Despite his affliction, he dreams of being a great horseman like the town’s hero, East Driscoll (Russell Crowe). Handsome and skilful, East is the most popular man in town, but as the boy discovers one summer, heroes can fall, and when East begins a passionate affair with an older woman, he comes face to face with a hard and cruel society with strict social taboos and even harsher penalties. It was a summer that would ultimately shape the rest of his life. NB: THIS PROGRAM IS RATED M. PARENTS SHOULD BE AWARE THAT IT IS SUITABLE FOR ADOLESCENTS ONLY.

results.title: Like water for chocolate = Como agua para chocolate
results.creator_credit: Alfonso Arau and Arau Films International
results.brief_description: Multi-award winning Mexican film which tells the story of Tita who is forbidden by tradition and a tyrannical mother to marry Pedro. Tita finds solace for her suppressed passion and sorrow in her cooking, which has a profound effect on all who partake. Based on Laura Esquivel’s best-seller, “Like water for chocolate” is an enchanting film which radiates warmth and emotional depth. It is visual feast starring Marco Leonardi, Lumi Cavazos and Regina Torne. Spanish dialogue. English subtitles.
